key_risks: Regulatory and legal risks, including ongoing investigations and potential legal liabilities
Cybersecurity and fraud risks, with vulnerabilities to data breaches and unauthorized transactions
Competitive pressures in the digital remittance space, with major players like Wise and Western Union
Operational risks due to reliance on partnerships with banks and payment processors
Foreign exchange volatility impacting customer satisfaction and margins
controversies: Investigation by law firms (Pomerantz LLP and The Schall Law Firm) following a significant stock price decline
Consumer complaints related to unauthorized transactions and fraud, with over 84 complaints documented between 2015 and 2019
social_issues: Customer complaints regarding transfer delays, fees, and service quality
Ongoing fraud-related issues and weaknesses in customer protection mechanisms
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny regarding anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) compliance
Potential legal liabilities from ongoing investigations
